body_html:
Yay! I finally figured it out with shared libraries.
For some reason on Mac I always get by .tf_configure.bazelrc truncated and it looses last 10 lines including build --define framework_shared_object=true which should unconditionally be there.

However it's not the end of the story. There is a ton of linker warnings getting generated during the build and it look like final shared library is still not functioning well. On anything more complex then TF hello world it results in:
'python' terminated by signal SIGSEGV (Address boundary error)

For some reason on Mac I always get by .tf_configure.bazelrc truncated and it looses last 10 lines including build --define framework_shared_object=true which should unconditionally be there.
However it's not the end of the story. There is a ton of linker warnings getting generated during the build and it look like final shared library is still not functioning well. On anything more complex then TF hello world it results in:
'python' terminated by signal SIGSEGV (Address boundary error)
body:
Yay! I finally figured it out with shared libraries.
For some reason on Mac I always get by `.tf_configure.bazelrc` truncated and it looses last 10 lines including `build --define framework_shared_object=true` which should **unconditionally** be there.

However it's not the end of the story. There is a ton of linker warnings getting generated during the build and it look like final shared library is still not functioning well. On anything more complex then `TF hello world` it results in:
`'python' terminated by signal SIGSEGV (Address boundary error)`
